newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's Koor Q2 EPS 12.61 vs 11.07.
newsitem.headline: Israel's Koor Q2 EPS 12.61 vs 11.07.

text.p: Net return on equity reached 13.4 percent during the first six months compared with 24.5 percent during all of 1995.

Koor CEO Benny Gaon said first-half results derived from Koor's new strategy of focusing on core businesses while dropping non-synergistic and non-profitable activities. He stressed that management would continue to concentrate on expanding core businesses by acquisitions in Israel and abroad.

Gaon said the improvement in results was especially noticeable given market conditions. The growing gap between inflation and the shekel exchange had a negative impact on exports and profits. Thirty-five percent of Koor's revenues derived from exports.
The company said exports reached $613 million compared to $569 million in the same period last year, an increase of 7.7 percent.
Net equity at the end of the second quarter of 1996 was $1.01 billion.
